descriptionMarkdown:
This blueprint is for experienced players with big base who are tired of ore transportation reconfiguration. Mining productivity level 20 is recommended. On low levels, first, ore from patches may deplete from just occupying the area. Second, rhizome consumes much resources to build. The hassle of ore transportation reconfiguration has to become bigger than hassle of building rhizome. Spidertron is required to go where rhizome is built.

Rhizome is a two-dimensional bus for 4 ore types:

1. Counterclockwise inner: coal (green light)
2. Counterclockwise outer: stone (purple light)
3. Clockwise inner: copper (yellow light)
4. Clockwise outer: iron (blue light)

Producers (miners) inject ore into rhizome, consumers (factories) extract ore. Roundabouts create physical environment in which density and pressure rule the ore flow from producers to consumers. Colored lights indicate ore movement. Solar panel and accumulators generate unlimited electricity.

Also there are pipes for liquid transport, but no direction alteration for them. There is implicit convention that liquids flowing to North and South are produced by [standard oil processing blueprint](https://factorioprints.com/view/-NdM4uesfTin68NuG2OG) in a strict specific order, and order of liquids flowing to East and West is arbitrary, can be used to transport one or more liquids and then be redirected to North-South.

Each 2x2 solar panel block can be replaced by [bot station blueprint](https://factorioprints.com/view/-NdLvl68N5kSpOWvK5ae) on demand. Each solar panel can be replaced with radar on demand. This way rhizome can grow further and further.

Guide for cell types:

1. Default cell (this)
2. [Naked cell](https://factorioprints.com/view/-NdL_F0b_0xJ7zs6M57d). May be the default one if you don't like solar energy
3. [Patch cell](https://factorioprints.com/view/-NdLeNK-HfderSsrLGgo) for water and forest
4. [Mining cell](https://factorioprints.com/view/-NdLp8qxC4fEIOjBPp79)
5. Injectors surrounding mining cells: [Western](https://factorioprints.com/view/-NdLstFQA_Qen0QLiREO), [Eastern](https://factorioprints.com/view/-NdLtygEUzjW1Z-Wneuh)

All cells let ore flow through, not blocking its way. All cells let liquid to flow through. But only default and naked cells contain roundabouts required to unleash rhizome's essential property of delivering ore everywhere. As soon as roundabout cells dominate above special cells, this is true.

Embedded factories are considered to consist of modified patch cells, sometimes surrounded by modified default cells to avoid errors of pipe connection.

Oil extraction starts from building patch cells. Patch cells can then be tweaked, underground belts and pipes can be moved around, to make free space where required. New factories are designed the same way. As soon as ore and liquid can flow through in all directions, this is fine.
title: Rhizome default cell
